subject: Design
title: The Invention of the Corridor
description: A quick, practical guide to The Invention of the Corridor.

hook.text: Before the 1600s, rooms connected directly to other rooms. There were no hallways.

buildup.text: To get from the kitchen to the bedroom, you walked through every room in between.

discovery.text: The corridor was invented so servants could move through houses without disturbing the family.

twist.text: A hallway is a privacy technology. It separated the served from the servers.

climax.text: The corridor transformed homes from connected rooms into zoned spaces with controlled access.

punchline.text: The hallway was invented for class separation, not convenience.

quiz.question: Why was the corridor invented?
options: So servants could move without disturbing residents
